Articles.Content:
Zip up your system folder and put it somewhere and I will take a look.

I private messaged you the link.

Edited January 15, 2014 by DarkStar64

I cant alter the radius of a body using either methods. In fact, i think it isnt working for Barney either (its meant to be 14000 km but is only 6000 km). Is this a bug i can expect or is it just me?

EDIT: Turns out i just wasnt running the "create scaled" command, and it just looked like the radius didnt change. I am not a smart man.

Edited March 8, 2014 by jesusHERCULESchrist

It's the most exciting mod i have ever got. thanks so much for this.

but i have a little question :

I want to add a new ring planet like sentar around kerbol.

So, I create a new folder withe name "URANIA"

and put this cfg :

PFBody

{

name=Urania

templateName=Jool

flightGlobalsIndex=720

}

CelestialBody

{

bodyDescription=Urania

GeeASL= 0.0112500333786

}

Orbit

{

inclination = 2.0

eccentricity = 0.01

semiMajorAxis = 100000000000

LAN = 0

argumentOfPeriapsis = 0

meanAnomalyAtEpoch = 0

epoch = 0

referenceBody = Sun

}

I also add all the sentar png with names changed for getting ring around my new planet, but if i well get my new planet, i unfortunnatly don't get the ring around it

I don't forget to put the "Urania_ring.png" in the same forlder and all ! So how do you create a new planet with sentar's ring like ?

Thanks so much again, it's totally georgous creating new worlds like this...

(P.S : i'm french, so excuse my pity english )

Sid

Edited January 16, 2014 by Sido

I cant alter the radius of a body using either methods. In fact, i think it isnt working for Barney either (its meant to be 14000 km but is only 6000 km). Is this a bug i can expect or is it just me?

In the case of Barney the cfg looks like this:

CelestialBody
{
	bodyDescription=Barney
	//GeeASL=0.66
	//Radius=14000
	rotates=True
...etc

The // means that line is commented out and has no effect. So Barney winds up being the same size as its template Tylo.
Rings are not yet supported in CFG planets. Next version.

Rings are not yet supported in CFG planets. Next version.

Thanks for your answer !

it would be excellent, once you put the rings gestion, to configurate the color of the line orbit when you look at your planet in orbit view.
We shoudl have some kind of list of existing planet-packs (and single planets ofc) made by players, avaible for download... just like with texture replaer packs.

Eeloo could use a moon. Something... distinctive.

What does it look like on the corners of that moon?

What does it look like on the corners of that moon?

Don't know. Its never been landed on. And only crashed into twice! (don't worry it buffed right out).

But if I had to guess I would say "pointy".

The die is cast... into orbit around Eeloo.

What does it look like on the corners of that moon?

I finally landed on it and it was really underwhelming. I am going to recall the system and make it asteroid size. And add a Fortress of Solitude Mountain Range at the north pole. <--One of these statements is not true.

Would it be possible for you, Krag, to make a mun for Eelio that has atmosphere only during part of the system's orbital cycle? so when it is closest to the sun, it has an atmosphere, and farthest from the sun there is no atmosphere.

This is awesome.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dodecahedron

And i hope you will post some file to download.

How about an asteroid with a hole through it? I dunno how the game engine would handle that tho. Maybe just an europa(icy moon) analouge. Even if eeloo already is kindof an europa analouge. Maybe just a new tiny asteroid like gilly. I like those

Other ideas not related to eeloo:

Or an even more extreme laythe-like waterworld with no land at all. Other ideas: lavaworld. Green eve-like world (radioactive). A huge barren world (1200km+) with a thin atmosphere. A small duna like world with a thicker atmosphere. An asteroid with a thin atmosphere. A tiny asteroid with very unrealistic jagged terrain (think armageddon)

Iwe also had a look at the alternis kerbol mod. In regards to the science arcives it dont break it but the archive dont seem to collect info from the ingame planets since they show as unaltered and not even in the order they appear in the alternis mod. In other words the planets that appear in the science archives always show up as stock. I dunno why pf breaks it but not alternis but planets probably need to be injected into the list used by the science archives seperatly from the pqs system.

Actually you can't put a ring on a config planet or moon.

but you can do a lot of other things, for exemple i made a terraformed mars planet named Ares around a gazed giant named Urania

View marineris valley from phobos :

And a double twin moon : HermÃƒÂ¨s (the orange one) and Hestia (the green one, a little smallest)

View from Hestia ground of her twin sister, of urania, ArÃƒÂ¨s and her two moons :love:

the little things i would need for a really terrific mod are :

- ring edition

- atmospheric color edition

- ocean color edition

with this, you could have the most impressive planet mod of KSP

(scuze my pity english, i'm french)

I might get to work on a Gliese 581-ish system, with a second Kerbin.

Is it possible to have oceans?

Really interesting projects in this thread ... ! I wonder when mods (or 'official' devs) will crack the mysteries on how to implement multiple solar system. Right now this seems to be impossible to implement due to lighting-effects and (I might have this one wrong) the fact Kerbol is the source of a certain root-system as far as coding and programming concerns.
